channel.title: US Congress on The Encryption Compendium
channel.description: Recent content in US Congress on The Encryption Compendium

item.title: Coalition Letter of Law Professors to Hon. Thomas J. Biley Regarding SAFE Amendments
item.description: Authors: None Identified Published: February 1999 URL: https://web.archive.org/web/19990224070155/http://www.cdt.org/crypto/legis_105/SAFE/97093_profs.html Tags: 1990s Academic Crypto Wars Crypto Wars I US Congress

item.title: Compliance with Court Orders Act of 2016 (Discussion Draft)
item.description: Authors: Feinstein, Dianne and Burr, Richard Published: April 2016 URL: https://www.feinstein.senate.gov/public/index.cfm?a=files.serve&File_id=5B990532-CC7F-427F-9942-559E73EB8BFB Tags: 2010s Compliance with Court Orders Act Going Dark Law Enforcement US Congress Abstract: Dianne Feinstein

item.title: Congress, Not the Attorney General, Should Decide the Future of Encryption
item.description: Authors: Rozenshtein, Alan Z. Published: February 2020 URL: https://www.lawfareblog.com/congress-not-attorney-general-should-decide-future-encryption Tags: 2020s End-to-End Encryption Going Dark Section 230 US Congress Abstract: If Congress wants to restrict end-to-end encryption, it should do so directly and not, as in the EARN IT Act, pass the buck to someone else.

item.title: H.R. 2545 - Data Breach Prevention and Compensation Act of 2019
item.description: Authors: Cummings, Elijah E. and Krishnamoorthi, Raja Published: May 2019 URL: https://www.congress.gov/bill/116th-congress/house-bill/2545/text Tags: 2010s Bill Data Breach Prevention and Compensation Act of 2019 Federal Trade Commission Office of Cybersecurity US Congress Abstract: To create an Office of Cybersecurity at the Federal Trade Commission for supervision of data security at consumer reporting agencies, to require the promulgation of regulations establishing standards for effective cybersecurity at consumer reporting agencies, to impose penalties on credit reporting agencies for cybersecurity breaches that put sensitive consumer data at risk, and for other purposes.

item.title: H.R. 4170 - Ensuring National Constitutional Rights for Your Private Telecommunications Act of 2019
item.description: Authors: Lieu, Ted and DelBene, Suzan and Jordan, Jim Published: August 2019 URL: https://www.congress.gov/116/bills/hr4170/BILLS-116hr4170ih.pdf Tags: 2019 Bill ENCRYPT Act of 2019 Federalism State's Rights US Congress Abstract: A Bill To preempt State data security vulnerability manfates and decryption requirements.

item.title: H.R. 4943 - Clarifying Lawful Overseas Use of Data Act
item.description: Authors: Collins, Doug Published: February 2018 URL: https://www.congress.gov/bill/115th-congress/house-bill/4943 Tags: 2010s Bill CLOUD Act Data Storage Foreign International Law Enforcement US Congress

item.title: H.R. 4978 - Online Privacy Act of 2019
item.description: Authors: Eshoo, Anna G. and Lofgren, Zoe Published: December 2019 URL: https://www.congress.gov/bill/116th-congress/house-bill/4978/text Tags: 2019 Bill Data Protection Online Privacy Act of 2019 Privacy Rights US Congress Abstract: To provide for individual rights relating to privacy of personal information, to establish privacy and security requirements for covered entities relating to personal information, and to establish an agency to be known as the United States Digital Privacy Agency to enforce such rights and requirements, and for other purposes.

item.title: Information Security and Privacy in Network Environments
item.description: Authors: Computing Technologies Program (Joan Winston) Telecommunications Published: September 1994 URL: https://www.epic.org/crypto/reports/ota_1994.html Tags: 1990s Crypto Wars Crypto Wars I US Congress

item.title: S. 1336 - Data Breach Prevention and Compensation Act of 2019
item.description: Authors: Warren, Elizabeth and Warner Published: May 2019 URL: https://www.congress.gov/bill/116th-congress/senate-bill/1336/text Tags: 2010s Bill Data Breach Prevention and Compensation Act of 2019 Federal Trade Commission Office of Cybersecurity US Congress Abstract: To create an Office of Cybersecurity at the Federal Trade Commission for supervision of data security at consumer reporting agencies, to require the promulgation of regulations establishing standards for effective cybersecurity at consumer reporting agencies, to impose penalties on credit reporting agencies for cybersecurity breaches that put sensitive consumer data at risk, and for other purposes.

item.title: S. 266 - Comprehensive Counter-Terrorism Act of 1991
item.description: Authors: Biden, Joseph Published: January 1991 URL: https://www.congress.gov/bill/102nd-congress/senate-bill/266/text Tags: 1990s Backdoors Government Access US Congress Abstract: Text for S.266 - 102nd Congress (1991-1992): Comprehensive Counter-Terrorism Act of 1991

item.title: S. 2889 - National Security and Personal Data Protection Act of 2019
item.description: Authors: Hawley, Josh and Cotton, Tom and Rubio, Marco Published: November 2019 Tags: 2010s Bill Cybersecurity Foreign Investment National Security and Personal Data Protection Act of 2019 Security Requirements US Congress Abstract: To safeguard data of Americans from foreign governments that pose risks to national security by imposing data security requirements and strengthening review of foreign investments, and for other purposes.

item.title: S.1842 - Protecting Personal Health Data Act
item.description: Authors: Klobuchar, Amy and Murkowski, Lisa Published: June 2019 URL: https://www.congress.gov/bill/116th-congress/senate-bill/1842/text Tags: 2010s Bill Encryption Standards Healthcare Policy Protecting Personal Health Data Act US Congress Abstract: To protect the personal health data of all Americans.

item.title: Senator Backs Off Backdoors
item.description: Authors: McCullagh, Declan Published: October 2001 URL: https://www.wired.com/2001/10/senator-backs-off-backdoors/ Tags: 2000s Backdoors Crypto Wars Crypto Wars II US Congress Abstract: A senator changes his mind after calling for a prohibition on data-scrambling products without backdoors for government surveillance. Now, he “has no intentions” of working on such an encryption bill. Declan McCullagh reports from Washington.

item.title: The EARN IT Act Is Unconstitutional: Fourth Amendment
item.description: Authors: Pfefferkorn, Riana Published: March 2020 URL: /blog/2020/03/earn-it-act-unconstitutional-fourth-amendment Tags: 2020s Stanford CIS US Congress
